page.title: 07WILD FLOWERS: WARLEY, ESSEX
page.content: Amongst the less common plant species found on roadside verges were {Hedge Bindweed, Marsh Bedstraw}and {Wild Rose.}The most interesting associations were found along Tomkyn's Lane, however, 566897, a narrow lane with little traffic. Expenditure cuts have meant that these verges are cut seldom. Trees overhang it, providing plenty of shade. Here were found plant associations not found elsewhere.{ {Lady's Smock, Wood Millet,}and{Dead {Nettle, Red Campion}and{Hoary {Plantain.}The track to a nearby farm had{Tufted Vetch}and{Early Purple {Orchid}beside it. Verge cutting, as well as the use of agricultural chemicals would seem to be responsible for the relative scarcity of many of England's wild flowers.
